metadata.title: CVE-2014-1425 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
cmanager 0.32 does not properly enforce nesting when modifying cgroupproperties, which allows local users to set cgroup values for all cgroupsvia unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgmanager - 0.24-0ubuntu7.1
cgmanager-tests - 0.24-0ubuntu7.1
cgmanager-utils - 0.24-0ubuntu7.1
libcgmanager0 - 0.24-0ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cgmanager package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24-0ubuntu7.1').
